definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: We can keep our hair tidy with a comb.
sentences.chinese: 我們能用梳子來保持頭髮的整潔。

sentences.english: An article, such as toothpaste or a hairbrush, used in personal grooming or dressing.
sentences.chinese: 一種用來梳刷馬匹的帶有金屬齒的梳子。

sentences.english: Combs were among the first and most popular objects made of celluloid.
sentences.chinese: 梳子是第一批也是最普遍的用賽璐珞製造的物品之一。

sentences.english: We will be growing our hair into backcombed bunches and glossing our lips scarlet
sentences.chinese: 把頭髮用梳子倒梳，猩紅脣色王道。

sentences.english: The comb-shape road The zigzag road looks like a comb from afar.
sentences.chinese: 《木梳路段》蜿蜒曲折的山路形狀像梳子一樣。

sentences.english: I combed my hair with my hair brush and made it into a pony.
sentences.chinese: 我用我的梳子梳頭並把頭髮弄成小馬辮。

sentences.english: Why did you buy him a hairbrush?He's as bald as a coot!
sentences.chinese: 你幹嘛給他買梳子？他頭上光禿禿的，一根頭髮。
那是一把鑲滿寶石的梳子。

sentences.english: Dicing a blade to a comb.
sentences.chinese: 把一把刀的刀刃切割成梳子狀。

sentences.english: The  comb is  combined with a bomb in the  tomb.
sentences.chinese: 梳子和墳墓裏的炸彈結合在一起。

sentences.english: With her hair gone, there could be no use for the comb.
sentences.chinese: 她的頭髮都沒有了，梳子也就沒什麼用了。

sentences.english: the comb is combined with a bomb in the tomb.
sentences.chinese: 梳子以及宅兆裏的槍榴彈結合在一路。

sentences.english: Use a wide-toothed comb rather than a brush to untangle hair.
sentences.chinese: 使用寬齒的梳子來梳理頭髮。

sentences.english: She absentmindedly played with some hairs which clung to the comb.
sentences.chinese: 她心不在焉地玩弄着梳子粘附着的幾根頭髮。

sentences.english: This comb is made from celluloid.
sentences.chinese: 這把梳子是假象牙做的。
